alert.note: Alert for Eastern Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 19 at 9:52AM EST until January 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO NOON EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Total snow accumulation 2 to 5 inches. Northwest winds gusting 25 to 35 mph this afternoon through Saturday morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. * WHERE...In Virginia, Eastern Highland County. In West Virginia, Eastern Pendleton County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM EST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 1 AM to noon EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
